baseline_groups.claim_summary: Height (deviation from grade mean) affects the amount given in dictator game experiments.
baseline_groups.notes: Baseline regresses amount given (proportion of endowment) on height with full controls and clustered SEs at the population level. Coefficient is -0.0018 (p=0.64), not significant.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Popularity (number of friend nominations) increases the total amount received from others in dictator games (earnings).
baseline_groups.notes: Table 6 from the paper. Coefficient is 0.0195 (p < 1e-8), highly significant. Different sample (N=330), outcome (receivesum), and treatment (popular) from G1.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Same-race pairs are more likely to form social network links (homophily in network formation).
baseline_groups.notes: Table 3. Linear probability model on network linking sample (N=55666). Coefficient is 0.0098 (p < 1e-10). Entirely different estimand, sample, and model from G1 and G2.

global_notes: Three distinct analyses: (1) dictator game giving and height, (2) earnings and popularity, (3) network formation homophily. Placebo randomized_height has the exact same coefficient as baseline, suggesting implementation error.
